page.title: 10St Thomas's church,Mossley
page.content: St Thomas's church is in the parish of All Saints,Bloxwich,and is a small but modern church built in 1959 for the residents of the Mossley Estate.Inside the building there is a multi-purpose hall which converts into a church when the partition is drawn back behind which are choir pews,litany desk,organ and altar with a cross of Christ.About 70 people attend the church.There are 2 services on Sunday,from 11.00 to midday and from 6.30 to 7.30.Communion service begins with a hymn,followed by the Collect,readings from the Bible,a sermon,prayers,the Offertory and finally the Eucharistic Feast.There is a Sunday School for children during this.Although licensed to do so 18 months ago,there have been no weddings as people tend to prefer the older parish church.On average 3 baptisms are performed monthly.
